description.en:
The ontology aims to define concepts within the Device Management domain, facilitating the remote administration of devices and ensuring their proper functioning. It addresses challenges related to the heterogeneity of management protocols by representing execution paths for commands and modeling the information exchanged between devices and the management system.

This ontology is developed as a SAREF extension.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Simplified definition and axiomatization of saref:Function. Added examples.

example.value: To accomplish the task of sensing the temperature, a temperature sensor should have a sensing function.
To accomplish the task of controlling the light, a smart light switch may have a function for turning on and off the light, and another to set the luminosity of the light.
To accomplish the task of washing clothes, a washing machine should have a function for washing.

comment.en: Logical groups of commands that devices support to accomplish their tasks. Function can act upon (OP saref:actsUpon and its sub-properties) features, properties, or states. An instance of saref:Function can apply to different devices.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:StopState is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:State in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The state of a device that is STOPPED

note.value: Functions of interest need not always be explicited. It depends on the use case. Typically, functions of interest are useful to specify which command is actually exposed, and which actual property of interest or state of interest it acts upon.
A function of interest is the function of (OP saref:isFunctionOfInterestOf) exactly one device.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:FunctionOfInterest, parallel to saref:PropertyOfInterest.

comment.en: Logical groups of commands that devices support to accomplish their tasks. Function can act upon (OP saref:actsUpon and its sub-properties) features, properties, or states. An instance of saref:FunctionOfInterest is supported by exactly one device.

A saref:Observation is the act of carrying out a procedure to estimate or calculate a value of a property of a feature of interest, or a state of a feature of interest. It links to a sensor to describe what made the observation, and to the observed feature, property, property of interest, state, or state of interest. Typically, its result is a property value or a state. An observation of a state (OP saref:observes) should have a state as a result (OP saref:hasResult). Respectively, an observation of a property should have a property value as a result.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Coal is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:Commodity in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of commodity

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:PowerUnit is deprecated. Will be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The unit of measure for power

note.value: Tasks can be accomplished by devices (saref:isAccomplishedBy).

example.value: For example, a washing machine is designed for the task of washing.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Cleaning is deprecated: may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of task for which a device is designed

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Lighting is deprecated: may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of task for which a device is designed

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Comfort is deprecated: may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of task for which a device is designed

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Washing is deprecated: may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of task for which a device is designed

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Safety is deprecated: may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of task for which a device is designed

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Entertainment is deprecated: may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of task for which a device is designed

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:MeterReading is deprecated: may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of task for which a device is designed

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:WellBeing is deprecated: may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of task for which a device is designed

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Drying is deprecated: may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of task for which a device is designed

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:EnergyEfficiency is deprecated: may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of task for which a device is designed
The goal for which a device is designed, from a user perspective.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Electricity is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:Commodity in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of energy commodity

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:PropertyValue to simplify the association of a measure to a property, without always needing it to be a measurement made by a device.

comment.en: Describes the value for a property. The property value is linked to its value expressed as an RDF literal (DP saref:hasValue), optionally to the unit of measurement (OP saref:isMeasuredIn), and optionally to the properties or properties of interest it is a value of (OP saref:isValueOfProperty).

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:HVAC for it's only an example.

comment.en: Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) device that provides indoor environmental comfort. A saref:HVAC is typically used to accomplish saref:Comfort.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:OnState is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:State in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The state of a device that is On

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:CloseState is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:State in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The state of a device that is CLOSE

A DM Server is the software entity which is responsible for performing DM operations on a fleet of Devices. It exposes the set of available operations to an entity that needs to trigger an operation, such as a manufacturer or a Customer Care service. 

The DM Server is a endpoint, generally secured, with which DM Clients communicate. 

The protocol used between Server and Client is not in the scope of this ontology. It can follow a DM standard such as CWMP or LWM2M, or be completely proprietary.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:OpenState is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:State in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The state of a device that is OPEN

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:StepUpCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Motion is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a unit of measure for motion

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:StartCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:LightSwitch for it's only an example.

comment.en: A switch that performs the saref:OnOffFunction, controls the property saref:Light, and can be found in the state saref:OnOffState. It can offer a switch on service. A saref:LightSwitch is typically used to accomplish saref:Lighting.

Software entity which represents a Device by exposing its DM Functions to one or more DM Server(s). 

It is responsible for the triggering of the DM Functions when a Command targetting the represented Device is received by the Server. The Client is also responsible for the reporting of the results of the Function execution to the Server.

The Client has an identifier that is unique only relatively to each Server it is connected to.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:DoorSwitch for it's only an example.

comment.en: A switch that performs the saref:OpenCloseFunction, is used for controlling a door, and can be found in the state saref:OpenCloseState. A saref:DoorSwitch is typically used to accomplish saref:Safety.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:OpenCloseFunction is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Function in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: An actuating function that allows to open and close a device

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:Time and use OWL Time instead whenever possible.

comment.en: A class that allows to specify the time concept.

note.value: The applicable context can be restricted to when the property of a feature of interest has some value (OPs saref:whenPropertyValue)
The applicable context can be restricted to when a feature of interest has a certain state (OPs saref:whenState).

OP saref:hasProfile links a device to its profile. The device should be linked to a certain commodity using OP saref:isUsedFor or its sub-properties, and optionally to some property or state using OP saref:actsUpon or its sub-properties.

The applicable context of a profile can be bound temporally using DP saref:hasTimestamp or its subproperties defined by SAREF extensions, or OP saref:hasApplicableTime which links to instant or interval or other compound temporal entity expressed using OWL Time.
OP saref:hasPrice links a profile to the money earned (negative values) or paid (positive values) for the use (production or consumption) of the commodity by the device.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Class saref:Profile has been re-specified, to take into account findings from SAREF4ENER V1.2.1.

comment.en: A saref:Profile describes the money earned (negative values) or paied (positive values) for the use (production or consumption) of a commodity by a device in a certain context.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:SwitchOnService is deprecated for it is just an example. It may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of service that represents an on/off function to the network

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:IlluminanceUnit is deprecated. Will be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The unit of measure for light

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Gas is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:Commodity in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of energy commodity

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:PressureUnit is deprecated. Will be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The unit of measure for pressure

Abstract representation of the connection between a Client and a Server. It does not necessarily imply that a persistent connection is established between the entities - such as a TCP connection. It represents the link and the capability of the Server to interact with the Client.

For instance, the Client has been authenticated by the Server with a certificate, and/or the client has received a configuration for access rights to its functions for the Server.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Energy is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value measured in an energy unit (such as Kilowatt_Hour or Watt_hour). Furter specializations of the saref:Energy class can be found in the SAREF4ENER extension, where classes such as EnergyMax, EnergyMin and EnergyExpected are defined.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Smoke is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a unit of measure for smoke

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Price is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF
Class saref:Price is deprecated in v3.2.1. In the next major revision of SAREF, it may be defined as an instance of saref:Property.

comment.en: A saref:Property crelated to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured using saref:Currency
This is a class of states for Device Management.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:ActuatingFunction is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Function in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A function that allows to transmit data to actuators, such as level settings (e.g., temperature) or binary switching (e.g., open/close, on/off)

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:PauseCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

Category of Functions related to the Device Management domain.

These Functions correspond to the capabilities of the Device to perform its own diagnostics, maintenance, configuration, monitoring and control.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:OpenCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:StepDownCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:StartState is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:State in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The state of a device that is STARTED

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:SetAbsoluteLevelCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of set level command

note.value: Concepts from existing code lists, vocabularies, and taxonomies, may be used as instances of saref:Property.

historyNote.value: Until SAREF V3.1.1, there was an ambiguity between whether properties should be specific or generic to features of interest. This ambiguity has been solved in SAREF V3.2.1, and the new modeling will be enforced in the next major revision of SAREF.
V3.2.1: The definition and scope of usage for saref:Property is clarified. Axiomatization is simplified.

example.value: Air temperature, pressure, luminance, etc. are all properties.

comment.en: Property kind that represents the properties of a Device Identity.

Property kind that represents the properties of the firmware of the device.

The device firmware is the running base software for the device, which is automatically loaded into memory and executed at boot.
Property kind that represents the properties of a DeviceModule
Property kind that represents the properties of a DevicePackage

comment.undefined:
Property kind that represents the properties of a Supported Datamodel Parameter.

These parameters represent the capabilities of the Device in a format specific to the datamodel implemented by the Device, and exposed by the Client.

It should not be confused with the Datamodel Parameter Instance, which represents the actionable capabilities of the Device.

comment.en:
Property kind that represents the properties of a Datamodel Parameter Instance.

These parameter instances represent the actionable capabilities of the Device in a format specific to the datamodel implemented by the Device, and exposed by the Client.

It should not be confused with the Supported Datamodel Parameter, which represents the abstract capabilities of the Device.
Identifiable qualities of features of interest that can be acted upon by devices, such as observed or controlled. A property can apply to different features of interest.

note.value: SAREF refers to energy commodities such as electricity, gas, coal and oil.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Definition of saref:Commodity is simplified.

comment.en: A marketable item which may be supplied without qualitative differentiation.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:EnergyUnit is deprecated. Will be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The unit of measure for energy

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:ProcedureExecution.

comment.en: Represents the act of carrying out a procedure.
State of a DevicePackage

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:TemperatureSensor for it's only an example.

comment.en: A sensor that is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Temperature. A saref:TemperatureSensor is typically used to saref:accomplish saref:Comfort.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Pressure is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a pressure unit (bar or pascal)

note.value: A state of interest is the state of (OP saref:isStateOfInterestOf) exactly one feature of interest.

States of interest need not always be explicited. It depends on the use case. Typically, states of interest are useful in applications, where the association between a feature of interest and a state (i.e., the state of interest) needs to be identified and related to other states of interest.
Per convention, the IRI of states of interest should consist of the IRI of their feature of interest, suffixed with a fragment identifier #{S} where {S} refers to the name of the state.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:StateOfInterest, parallel to saref:PropertyOfInterest.

comment.en: Identifiable conditions that features of interest are or may be in, and that can be acted upon by devices, such as observed and controlled. An instance of saref:StateOfInterest is specific to a feature of interest. It is inherent to and cannot exist without that feature of interest.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:SmokeSensor for it's only an example.

comment.en: A sensor that performs the saref:SensingFunction and the saref:EventFunction, and is used for the purpose of sensing a property of type saref:Smoke. A saref:SmokeSensor is typically used to saref:accomplish saref:Safety.

historyNote.value: Class saref:Currency is deprecated in v3.2.1 and may deleted in the next major revision of SAREF. Existing code lists and taxonomies can be reused instead.

comment.en: The class of units of measure for price

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:StartStopFunction is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Function in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: An actuating function that allows to start and stop a device

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: New category of commodities saref:NaturalResourceCommodity

comment.en: The class of natural resource commodities

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:SetLevelCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

A saref:Actuation is the act of carrying out a procedure to control the state of the world using an actuator. It links to an actuator to describe what made the actuation, and to the controlled feature, property, property of interest, state, or state of interest. Typically, its input is a property value or a state. An actuation of a state (OP saref:controls) should have a state as input (OP saref:hasInput). Respectively, an actuation of a property should have a property value as input.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:MeteringFunction is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Function in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A function that allows to get data from a meter, such as current meter reading or instantaneous demand

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:GetMeterDataCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of get command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Water is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:Commodity in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of commodity

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:OpenCloseState is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:State in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of state

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:NotifyCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:MultiLevelState is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:State in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of state

A tangible object that has at least one Device Management Function.

This class extends the saref:Device class, it is a Feature of Interest by definition.
Category of Commands that are specific to the Device Management domain.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:Measurement in favour of saref:Observation, to generalize to observation of states and convergence with SOSA/SSN.

comment.en: Represents the measured value made over a property. It is also linked to the unit of measure in which the value is expressed and the timestamp of the measurement.

A saref:Service that represents functions or functions of interest of the Device Management Function Category.

The ManagementService exposes these functions through a Connection, between a Client and a Server.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Simplified definition and axiomatization of saref:Command. Added examples.

example.value: Observe property, control property, observe state, control state, invoke action, cancel action, turn on or off, change color, subscribe, publish, etc. are all commands.

comment.en: The lowest-level directives a function exposes to some network. Commands can act upon (OP saref:actsUpon and its sub-properties) features, properties, or states. An instance of saref:Command is independent of any device.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Power is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a power unit (such as watt or kilowatt).  Further specializations of the saref:Power class can be found in the SAREF4ENER extension, where classes such as PowerMax, PowerMin and PowerExpected are defined.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:LevelControlFunction is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Function in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: An actuating function that allows to do level adjustments of a property in a certain range (e.g., 0%-100%), such as dimming a light in a room or setting the speed of an electric motor.

note.value: Concepts from existing code lists, vocabularies, and taxonomies, may be used as instances of saref:UnitOfMeasure. For example the QUDT Unit vocabulary
Our definition is based on the definition of unit of measure in the Ontology of units of Measure (OM).

example.value: For example, consumption power is a property and Watt is a unit of power that represents a definite predetermined power: when we say 10 Watt, we actually mean 10 times the definite predetermined power "Watt".

comment.en: The unit of measure is a standard for measurement of a quantity, such as a Property.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:OffState is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:State in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The state of a device that is Off

note.value: Commands of interest need not always be explicited. It depends on the use case. Typically, commands of interest are useful to specify the actual property of interest or state of interest that is expected as input parameter, output, or that will be acted upon.
Like for commands, commands of interest may be described in terms of their input parameters, outputs, and of which properties or states they act upon.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:CommandOfInterest, parallel to saref:PropertyOfInterest.

example.value: The smart fridge supports a command of kind “observe temperature”, which observes the temperature of the fridge.
The corridor smart light switch supports a command of kind “turn on/off”, which controls the state of the outdoor light.

comment.en: The lowest-level directives a device supports and exposes to some network. Commands can act upon (OP saref:actsUpon and its sub-properties) features, properties, or states. A saref:CommandOfInterest is a directives actually supported by a device and exposed to some network.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Definition of Sensor is simplified and grounded on saref:observes. Local restriction on saref:hasFunction is deleted.

comment.en: A device designed to observe one or more properties or states of one or more features of interest.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: New category of commodities saref:EnergyCommodity

comment.en: The class of energy commodities

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:StartStopState is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:State in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of state

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:SetRelativeLevelCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of set level command

note.value: SAREF is not restricted to binary states such as the saref:OnOffState, but allows to define also n-ary states (see, for example, the saref:MultiLevelState class).
Concepts from existing code lists, vocabularies, and taxonomies, may be used as instances of saref:State.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Clarified and generalized definition of saref:State. Can now apply to all features of interest, not just devices.

example.value: A switch can be found in the saref:OnOffState, which is further specialized in saref:OnState and saref:OffState.

comment.en: Identifiable conditions that features of interest are or may be in, and that can be acted upon by devices, such as observed and controlled. A state can apply to different features of interest.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Light is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a illuminance unit (lux)

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:TemperatureUnit is deprecated. Will be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: The unit of measure for temperature

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Humidity is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a humidity unit

A DeviceModule is an executable software entity on the Device, i.e., a DeviceModule may be activated and deactivated on demand through dedicated Functions.

As such, the DeviceModule implements specific Functions that are available to the Device when the DeviceModule is activated.

A DeviceModule is supported by a DevicePackage: deleting the corresponding DevicePackage will in turn remove the DeviceModule and its related Functions.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Temperature is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value that is measured in a temperature unit (degree_Celsius, degree_Fahrenheit, or degree_kelvin)

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Definition of saref:Appliance is grounded on tasks and commodities.

comment.en: A device designed to accomplish a particular task for occupant use. It consumes, produces, or stores, some commodity.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:OnOffFunction is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Function in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: An actuating function that allows to switch on and off an actuator

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:SensingFunction is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Function in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A function that allows to transmit data from sensors, such as measurement values (e.g., temperature) or sensing data (e.g., occupancy)

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:OnCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

Describes the execution of an operation in a network: the–machine interpretable–  description of a communication between devices over the network. Typically, its input and result are network messages, that conform to the input and output of the executed operation.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:Switch for it's only an example.

comment.en: A device of category saref:Actuator that performs an actuating function of type saref:OnOffFunction or saref:OpenCloseFunction

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:GetSensingDataCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of get command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:GetCurrentMeterValueCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of get command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:GetMeterHistoryCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of get command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Definition of Actuator is simplified and grounded on saref:controls. Local restriction on saref:hasFunction is deleted.

comment.en: A device designed to control one or more properties or states of one or more features of interest.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Definition of Meter is simplified and grounded on saref:observes. Local restriction on saref:hasFunction is deleted.

comment.en: A device designed to observe and measure one or more properties of one or more features of interest.

note.value: An operation may be described in terms of its inputs and outputs using OP saref:hasInput and saref:hasOutput. Inputs and outputs of operations typically describe the expected schema or shape of network messages.

Typically, a device connected to a given network offers one service for each of its functions of interest, and each service has one operation per command of interest of the function of interest it represents.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:Operation and associated properties from oneM2M base ontology.

example.value: In the set of operations exposed by a smart washing machine on a given network, one may be dedicated to set the water temperature for the washing cycle, and expected as input a enumerated value. Another one may be dedicated to start, pause, or stop the washing cycle.
To turn on a light, send a CoAP PUT request with CBOR content 0xf5 (true)

In the set of operations exposed by a smart light bulb on a given network, one may be dedicated to turn on and off the light and expect a boolean as input. Another one may be dedicated to set the luminosity status and expect a target luminosity level (a byte) and a transition time (encoded on two bytes).

comment.en: A saref:Operation is the means of a service to communicate in a procedure-type manner over the network (i.e. transmit data to/from other devices). It is the –machine interpretable– exposure of a –human understandable– command to a network.

note.value: A property of interest is the property of (OP saref:isPropertyOfInterestOf) exactly one feature of interest.

Properties of interest need not always be explicited. It depends on the use case. Typically, properties of interest are useful in applications, where the association between a feature of interest and a property (i.e., the property of interest) needs to be identified and related to other properties of interest.
Per convention, the IRI of properties of interest should consist of the IRI of their feature of interest, suffixed with a fragment identifier #{P} where {P} refers to the name of the property.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:PropertyOfInterest to solved the ambiguity between generic vs specific properties.

comment.en: Identifiable qualities of features of interest that can be acted upon by devices, such as observed or controlled. An instance of saref:PropertyOfInterest is specific to a feature of interest. It is inherent to and cannot exist without that feature of interest.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:EventFunction is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Function in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A function that allows to notify about some relevant activity; e.g., that a certain threshold value has been exceeded or that some object has moved.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:StopCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command
State of a DeviceModule

A DevicePackage is an archive file that may contain resource files, code, libraries or executable files.
It is a resource that the Device should retrieve or receive from an external source.

A DevicePackage is only actionable once it has been downloaded and installed.

It may allow a Device to support additional Functions by instantiating a DeviceModule.

A DevicePackage may be uninstalled and then removed from the Device.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:OnOffState is deprecated: will be defined as an instance of saref:State in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of state

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:CloseCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

note.value: Typically, a device connected to a given network offers one service for each of its functions of interest.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Simplified definition of saref:Service. Added examples.

example.value: For example, a light switch can offer the service of remotely switching the lights in a home through mobile phone devices that are connected to the local network (ex:SwitchOnService class). This "remote switching" service represents the ex:OnOffFunction.

comment.en: A saref:Service is a digital representation of a function in a network, making it discoverable, registerable and remotely controllable in the network.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:ToggleCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:OffCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

Describes the execution of a command. Typically, its inputs and outputs are human understandable and relate to some feature of interest, such as its state (e.g., s4abcd:On), or the value of its temperature (e.g., property value 21.0 °C).

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Definition of saref:FeatureOfInterest is clarified, not only properties are measured, but properties and states can be observed and controlled.
V3.2.1: Definition of saref:FeatureOfInterest: allValuesFrom axioms are unnecessary and have been deleted.
V3.2.1: Definition of saref:FeatureOfInterest: Clarify it's a specific real world entity.

comment.en: A feature of interest represents any real world entity from which a property or a state may be acted upon, such as observed and controlled. An instance of saref:FeatureOfInterest represents one specific real world entity.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Occupancy is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A saref:Property related to some measurements that are characterized by a certain value (saref:hasValue property) that is measured in a unit of measure for occupancy

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:GetCommand is deprecated: may be defined as an instance of saref:Command in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A type of command

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Use SKOS to organize generic classes in taxonomies.
V3.2.1: Introduced class saref:FeatureKind

comment.en: Feature kinds allow to describe kinds of features of interest, with common properties having the same value, and common states being the same. An instance of saref:FeatureKind represents an archetype of real world entities, for example to populate product catalogs.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:Device is explicitly a subclass of saref:FeatureOfInterest and s4syst:System.
V3.2.1: definition of saref:Device clarifies it's a real world entity.
V3.2.1: Most axioms on saref:Device were useless and have been deleted.

example.value: For example, a washing machine is designed to wash (task) and to accomplish this task it performs a start and stop function.

Examples of devices are a light switch, a temperature sensor, an energy meter, a water flow meter, and a laundry dryer. A laundry dryer is designed to dry laundry, and to accomplish this task it has a start/stop function.

comment.en: A tangible object designed to accomplish a particular task. In order to accomplish this task, the device performs one or more functions. An instance of saref:Device represents one specific real world entity.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:controlsProperty is deprecated: will be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A relationship specifying the property that can be controlled by a certain device

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:consumes, saref:isConsumedBy, saref:produces, saref:isProducedBy, saref:stores, saref:isStoredBy.

comment.en: Links a feature kind, feature of interest, or device, to the commodity it consumes

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Relaxed domain of saref:isMeasuredIn so it can apply to saref:PropertyValue as well as saref:Measurement. The new range will be enforced in the next major revision of SAREF.

comment.en: A relationship identifying the unit of measure used for a certain entity.
DEPRECATED: The use of rdfs:comment is recommended instead.
Links a commodity to the feature kind, feature of interest, or device, that produces it

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:isMeasurementOf together with saref:Measurement.

comment.en: A relationship between a measurement and the feature of interest whose quality was measured

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced property saref:observes, as sub-property of saref:actsUpon. and generalization of measures.

comment.en: Links a device, function, command, or procedure execution, to the feature, property, or state, it observes.
Links an entity (e.g., a profile) to an instant or interval or other compound temporal entity expressed using OWL Time, which bounds temporally the applicable context of that entity.

historyNote.value: Property saref:isAbout is too vague and has been deprecated in v3.2.1.

comment.en: A relationship identifying what an entity, such as a profile, is about
Links a profile to a property value that contributes to restricting its applicable context.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:hasSensingRange is deprecated together with saref:SensingFunction. And may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A relationship between a sensing function and a measurement identifying the range of a sensor detection

Links a device to its kind, a feature kind. Kinds of devices describe models of devices, with common properties having the same value, common states being the same, common functions, and common services.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:hasPropertyOfInterest and saref:isPropertyOfInterestOf. Cannot use saref:hasProperty due to the combination of cardinality restrictions and sub-property chain axioms makes the ontology exist the OWL 2 DL prodile.

comment.en: Links a feature of interest to one of its properties of interest.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced mandatory and optional commands.

comment.en: Links a function and one of its mandatory commands

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Clarified definition of saref:isOfferedBy.

comment.en: Links a service to the device that exposes it to a network
Links some entity to its identifier. Extensions of SAREF may define sub-properties such as s4abcd:hasUUID, s4abcd:hasGTIN12, etc.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:hasSensingRange is deprecated together with saref:SensingFunction. Use saref:hasDeviceKind instead.

comment.en: A relationship identifying the sensing type of a sensor detection (i.e., Temperature, Occupancy, Humidity, Motion , Smoke, Pressure, etc.)

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:makesMeasurement is deprecated as one of the properties related to saref:Measurement. It may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A relation between a device and the measurements it makes. Such measurement will link together the value of the measurement, its unit of measure and the property to which it relates.
Links a property to the feature kind or feature of interest it is a property of.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced property saref:isActedUponBy.

comment.en: Links a feature, property, or state, to the device, function, command, or procedure execution, that acts on it.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Domain of saref:hasCommand is relaxed to saref:Function or saref:FunctionOfInterest.

comment.en: Links a function or function of interest and the command it supports.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:actsUpon now holds not only between a command and a state. It generalizes actsUpon, observes, controls. Domain and range are unions of several classes.

comment.en: Links a device, function, command, or procedure execution, to the feature, property, or state, it acts upon.
Links a property of interest to the feature of interest it is a property of.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Add local restrictions on consistsOf on feature of interest

comment.en: A relationship indicating a composite entity that consists of other entities (e.g., a temperature/humidity sensor that consists of a temperature sensor and a humidity sensor)

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:measuresProperty is deprecated: will be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A relationship specifying the property that can be measured by a certain device

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Add local restrictions on consistsOf on feature of interest

comment.en: A relationship indicating a composite entity that consists of other entities (e.g., a temperature/humidity sensor that consists of a temperature sensor and a humidity sensor)

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:hasMeasurement together with saref:Measurement.

comment.en: A relationship between a feature of interest and a measurement about it

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduce saref:madeBy (resp. saref:madeExecution) as generalization of saref:measurementMadeBy (resp. saref:makesMeasurement).

comment.en: Links a procedure execution to the entity (e.g., device) that made it.
Links a feature kind, feature of interest, or device, to the commodity it stores

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:isMeasuredByDevice is deprecated: will be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A relationship specifying the devices that can measure a certain property

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:hasTypicalConsumption. May be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF.

comment.en: A relationship identifying the typical (energy or power) consumption of a device

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:hasTime and use OWL Time instead whenever possible.

comment.en: A relationship to associate time information to an entity

Links a profile to the device it describes. The device should be linked to a certain commodity using OP saref:isUsedFor or its sub-properties, and optionally to some property or state using OP saref:actsUpon or its sub-properties.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: applicability of saref:hasProperty is relaxed to also saref:FeatureKind

comment.en: Links a feature kind or a feature of interest to one of its properties.
Links an operation to the service it belongs to.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Relaxed domain and range of saref:represents.

comment.en: Links a service to some function or function of interest it exposes to the network. Also links an operation to some command or command of interest it exposes to the network.
Links a command execution to the command or command of interest that was executed. Also liks an operation execution to the operation that was executed

note.value: When the execution time and the phenomenon time are the same time instants, then DP saref:hasTimestamp can be used to simply link a procedure execution to the time of these instants, expressed as an xsd:dateTime literal.
Applied on a profile, it describes the applicable instant of that profile

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Tried to clarify definition of saref:hasTimestamp. Still unclear.

comment.en: Links a procedure execution or a profile to an instant.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:isMeasurementOf together with saref:Measurement.

comment.en: A relationship between a measurement and the property it relates to

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduce saref:madeBy (resp. saref:madeExecution) as generalization of saref:measurementMadeBy (resp. saref:makesMeasurement).

comment.en: Links a procedure execution to the entity (e.g., device) that made it.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Clarified definition of saref:hasValue.

comment.en: Value of a property value expressed as an RDF literal. Note that, even if decimal values are expected, values could use other datatypes.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Relaxed domain of saref:isMeasuredIn so it can apply to saref:PropertyValue as well as saref:Measurement. The new range will be enforced in the next major revision of SAREF.

comment.en: A relationship identifying the unit of measure used for a certain entity.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Relaxed domain of saref:hasState.

comment.en: Links a feature kind or a feature of interest to one of its states.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:isMeasurementOf together with saref:Measurement.

comment.en: A relationship between a measurement and the feature of interest whose quality was measured

historyNote.value: saref:hasPrice is deprecated in v3.2.1, and may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF. Use saref:profileHasPrice instead.

comment.en: A relationship indentifying the price associated to an entity

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:isStateOf.

comment.en: Links a state to the feature kind or feature of interest it is a state of.
Links a function of interest to the device it is a function of.

note.value: When the execution time and the phenomenon time are the same time instants, then DP saref:hasTimestamp can be used to simply link a procedure execution to the time of these instants, expressed as an xsd:dateTime literal.
Applied on a profile, it describes the applicable instant of that profile

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Tried to clarify definition of saref:hasTimestamp. Still unclear.

comment.en: Links a procedure execution or a profile to an instant.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Domain of saref:hasFunction is relaxed.

comment.en: Links a feature kind or a device to one of its functions.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: deprecated saref:hasMeterReading together with saref:Measurement and saref:MeteringFunction

comment.en: A relationship between a metering function and the measurement of the reading

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:isFunctionOf.

comment.en: Links a function to the feature kind or device it is a function of.
Links a service to one of its operations.
Links an entity (e.g., device) to the procedure execution it made.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:hasPropertyValue.

comment.en: Links a feature kind, a feature of interest, or a property of interest, to a property value.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:hasResultTime as part of general will to make SAREF and SOSA/SSN converge.

comment.en: Links a procedure execution to the instant of time when the activity was completed, expressed as an xsd:dateTime literal.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:isControlledByDevice is deprecated: will be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A relationship specifying the devices that can control a certain property

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:isMeasurementOf together with saref:Measurement.

comment.en: A relationship between a measurement and the property it relates to
Links a commodity to the feature kind, feature of interest, or device, that consumes it
Links a certain entity (e.g., a device) to the task it accomplishes.
Links a device to one of its functions of interest.
Links a commodity to the feature kind, feature of interest, or device, that stores it

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Defined domain of saref:hasManufacturer to union of feature kind and feature of interest.

comment.en: A relationship identifying the manufacturer of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag.
Links a feature kind, feature of interest, or device, to the commodity it produces
A relationship identifying an entity (e.g., a device) that can accomplish a task.
Links a function of interest to one of its commands of interest.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:isValueOfProperty.

comment.en: Links a property value to the property or property of interest it is a value of.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:hasPhenomenonTime as part of general will to make SAREF and SOSA/SSN converge.

comment.en: Links a procedure execution to the time that the result applies. It may be an interval or an instant, or some other compound temporal entity expressed using OWL Time.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced property saref:isControlledBy.

comment.en: Links a feature, property, or state, to the device, function, command, or procedure execution, that controls it.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Deprecated saref:isMeasurementOf together with saref:Measurement.

comment.en: A relationship between a property and the measurements it relates to

example.value: Different complementary commands can be defined for observing a smart home. Observe the temperature once will output the indoor temperature property; observe status of the entry door will output an open/close state.

comment.en: Links a command or operation to its outputs.
links a state of interest to its kind, a state
Links a feature, property, or state, to the device, function, command, or procedure execution, that observes it.
Links a command of interest to the function of interest it is a command of.
Links a profile to the money earned (negative values) or paid (positive values) for the use (production or consumption) of the commodity by the device
links a function of interest to its kind, a function
Links a command and a function or function of interest that supports it.
links a command of interest to its kind, a command.
Links a state of interest to the feature of interest it is a state of.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: deprecated saref:hasMeterReadingType together with saref:MeteringFunction

comment.en: A relationship identifying the reading type of a metering function (e.g., Water, Gas, Pressure , Energy , Power, etc.)

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:hasStateOfInterest and saref:isStateOfInterestOf, parallel to saref:hasPropertyOfInterest and saref:isPropertyOfInterestOf.

comment.en: Links a feature of interest to one of its states of interest.
Links a profile to a state that contributes to restricting its applicable context.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced property saref:controls, as sub-property of saref:actsUpon. and generalization of saref:controlsProperty.

comment.en: Links a device, function, command, or procedure execution, to the feature, property, or state, it controls.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Clarified definition of saref:offers.

comment.en: Links a device to a service it exposes to a network.

scopeNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:isUsedFor is deprecated for its name is not clear. For example if a device consumes electricity, it doesn't mean this is what it is used for.

comment.en: Links a feature kind, feature of interest, or device, to the commodity it is used for

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduce saref:madeBy (resp. saref:madeExecution) as generalization of saref:measurementMadeBy (resp. saref:makesMeasurement).

comment.en: Links a procedure execution to the entity (e.g., device) that made it.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:hasThresholdMeasurement is deprecated together with saref:EventFunction. And may be defined as an instance of saref:Property in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A relationship associated with an event function to notify that a certain threshold measurement has been exceeded

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduce hasClassKind for Class is Feature, Device, Property, State, Function, Command.

comment.en: links a feature of interest to its kind, a feature kind
Links a function and one of its optional commands

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:hasInput and saref:hasOutput.

example.value: Different complementary commands can be defined for controlling a light. Turn on or off the light based on a desired state, toggle the light status of a specific light, set the luminosity level with a transition time, set the default transition time, start comfort.

comment.en: Links a command, operation, or procedure execution, to its inputs.
links a property of interest to its kind, a property.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Introduced saref:hasResult as part of general will to make SAREF and SOSA/SSN converge.

comment.en: Links a procedure execution (e.g., an observation) to its result (e.g., a property value).

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Defined domain of saref:hasModel to union of feature kind and feature of interest.

comment.en: A relationship identifying the model of an entity (e.g., device). The value is expected to be a string or a string with language tag.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: saref:makesMeasurement is deprecated as one of the properties related to saref:Measurement. It may be deleted in the next major revision of SAREF

comment.en: A relation between a measurement and the device that made it.

historyNote.value: V3.2.1: Relaxed domain of saref:hasProfile to saref:FeatureKind or saref:Device

comment.en: Links a device to its profile. Its inverse is saref:isProfileOf. The device should be linked to a certain commodity using OP saref:isUsedFor or its sub-properties, and optionally to some property or state using OP saref:actsUpon or its sub-properties.
Links a command execution to the command or command of interest that was executed. Also liks an operation execution to the operation that was executed
